abstract: Parents in California who are at the heart of America's anti-vaccine movement defend their stance in wake of nationwide measles outbreak; public health officials are alarmed at growing number of measles cases, and many people blame parents who refuse to vaccinate their children for incubating possible epidemic.
lead_paragraph: As officials in 14 states grapple with a measles outbreak, the parents at the heart of America’s anti-vaccine movement are being blamed for a public-health crisis.

byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Huntington Beach, and Michael Paulson from Kearny, Ariz. Reporting was contributed by Patricia Leigh Brown in New Haven; Denise Grady in New York; Carol Pogash in Marin County, Calif., and Kristina Rebelo in Orange County, Calif.
byline.original: By JACK HEALY and MICHAEL PAULSON

snippet: As officials in 14 states grapple with a measles outbreak, the parents at the heart of America’s anti-vaccine movement are being blamed for a public-health crisis.

headline.main: Vaccine Critics Turn Defensive Over Measles
headline.print_headline: Vaccine Critics Turn Defensive Over Measles
